name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"ecadb2ab-05df-4cf8-976f-7339c86e032e","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Definition, Resolution, and Data Extraction","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1dd56333-b546-4a98-9aa5-e675f2fd07b3","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"This group bridges the gap between raw AST nodes and the analysis model. They perform lookups to see where a variable was defined, determine return types, resolve list/dict contents, and handle complex reference logic (like "points-to" analysis).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1283c368-b42d-4f83-b08c-f19bb16ac78f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This operational layer provides the semantic intelligence for the analyzer. While other groups handle the "walking" of the code or the "managing" of the stack, this group focuses on the "meaning" of the identifiers found. It transforms syntactic structures into a logical map of data flow, ensuring that every variable reference is accurately linked to its source definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4aa17341-30ed-47e1-ae4f-4f92ec760f1f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"37621f17-35b3-495d-9ee7-57eed6a552c2","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Subgroups","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"037301cd-53e3-4eaf-ba2d-178142115f88","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"1. Reference Resolution & Points-To Analysis","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"692cad01-88ea-483b-8020-075160661357","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods constitute the core "semantic" engine of the processor. They are responsible for determining what specific definition or value a variable refers to at a given point in the code. They handle the complex logic of resolving chains of references, list contents, and coordinates.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"710ee14b-3a86-40ff-9163-1389bb6cd628","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Responsibilities:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e0d17fda-52c5-4dc7-92c0-debf4ca6558c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Tracing variable references back to their absolute origin through multiple assignments.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"06b3658f-c694-4050-9e63-927301648311","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Standardizing various internal object representations into clean lists of namespaces.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5e9ba0f1-d27b-4dd2-bb86-8277babc8977","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Handling the inter-procedural logic required to resolve function return values and parameters.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6a7bd122-6271-4e04-b814-d483f134079b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"2. Scope & Attribute Lookup","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3873b0fa-fc44-4fcf-932d-a721df27af6e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods facilitate the search for existing definitions within specific contexts. They handle the mechanics of looking up attributes (fields), class methods, built-in functions, or verifying if a definition exists within a specific scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"57b2830b-a164-40d5-a860-680255a670a5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Responsibilities:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9dd45dbf-5f2a-4510-8f10-1832cdb7f3a2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Resolving dotted access (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"obj.attr","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") by searching through object and class hierarchies.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9f4dffe7-022c-457c-a539-edb4c17ff7c0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Implementing inheritance-aware lookups using Method Resolution Order (MRO).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"72df61dc-36f3-42eb-bb8c-b80eecb53c48","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Validating variable visibility to distinguish between local definitions and parent-scope modifications.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a3fa85d0-d483-4411-9a4e-938e510e7f0b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"3. Node Decoding & Extraction","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8a9b0698-7e00-40d6-934f-5862a8f5bc12","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods are responsible for parsing specific raw AST nodes to extract immediate, usable data before deep resolution occurs. They handle the initial translation of syntax trees into the processor's internal data formats.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2e468bcf-d920-489e-8457-5f752b5cd501","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Responsibilities:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d09e5d6c-c29c-4f77-ac0e-c1d3925d74ac","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Mapping structural AST nodes to logical definitions and internal type tags (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<int>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7b89aff3-721f-4795-8a05-d1d2c4705e48","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Extracting meta-information such as function default values and source code line ranges.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"98957aa8-c5f8-4281-9a4e-9239578eeaef","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Processing complex expressions like subscripts and collection literals to identify their component parts.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"410c771f-8e02-4b4e-a0e5-31b2552585b7","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"4. Data Transformation & Conversion","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"de790809-de01-4f58-b050-019062a7bb88","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods focus on processing the results of the analysis into a final format. They likely handle the serialization or flattening of complex internal objects into the final output structure required by the tool.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e29e8c09-9c7b-44df-802a-13d45cd9382d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Responsibilities:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2eef520a-8fb7-4148-ae71-816708caa473","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Executing path-aware traversals to resolve the ultimate values of variable chains.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cf27f6aa-30bb-4300-b366-e3ea5f88a0d1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Normalizing internal placeholders into standardized symbolic forms for output.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a66c24e0-e257-4091-b087-f70a521938b2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Cleaning up and deduplicating analysis results to provide a clear and actionable semantic model.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"095fc05c-3213-4f38-b775-e820946e6f79","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
